CatDescriptText: Emily Calloway, teacher, Sewickley, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 3, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that integration in all schools in the South should be effected immediately, or do you favor permitting a reasonable length of time?  If so, how long a period do you consider as a "reasonable length of time?"  Answer reads: "There should be a reasonable amount of time given for it to be successful.  This would reduce the problems.  I can't say how much time should be given."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Emily Calloway wearing eyeglasses and dark coat with circular brooch on left collar, standing in front of building with signs for Dr. Gamble, Dentist, Theosophical Society, and B&G restaurant signs, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Emily Calloway wearing eyeglasses and dark coat with circular brooch on left collar, standing in front of B/G Restaurant with two glass doors, Smithfield Street, Downtown
